RONIN | Digital Special Edition



The RONIN Digital Special Edition includes a digital comic that dives into the backstory behind the game and the complete original soundtrack in MP3 and FLAC formats. Files can be found in the RONIN folder on your computer.

READ MORE

About This Game

Ronin is stylish a turn-based action platformer following the exploits of a vengeful heroine determined to strike down five prominent figures of a powerful corporation. Move with precision by meticulously planning out each silent step, soaring leap, and devastating swing of your blade from the shadows as you seek your revenge.

Turn-Based Action: Carefully plot your movements to setup the perfect strike before retreating back into the shadows or boldly confronting your opposition head-on with your katana.

Decisive Strikes: Dispatch all that oppose you with your lethal blade and razor wire or avoid their attacks with a holographic replicator and grappling hook to find a more advantageous position.

Path to Vengeance: Battle through over fifteen complex missions as you stalk and cut down five closely guarded figures within a secretive conglomerate.
READ MORE

126 of 151 people (83%) found this review helpful
11

1 person found this review funny
El Kemosabe
877 products in account
140 reviews
Not Recommended
6.9 hrs on record
Posted: September 10
Ronin is a turn-based action game about a "vengeful heroine" going on a mission to kill five people who have done something to her. Your father has been killed and his death is somehow linked to five men you can see in a photograph with you and your father. As your father's only child you take it upon yourself

+Great art style which suits the game well
+The skills which you can unlock over the course of the game are really fun to use, for example you can unlock the ability to throw your sword at enemies or hang enemies from the ceiling to kill them stealthily
+Once you've got your head around the turn-based combat mechanics, combat against a small number of enemies can be quite fun. Combat mainly consists of jumping into enemies to knock them over and then stab them but it can be quite challenging when you also have several enemies shooting at you
+Stealth sections of the game are incredibly fun, especially once you've unlocked the hanging enemies skill
+Each mission has three overall objectives (admittedly they're the same across all the levels) which, when all three are completed, grant you a skill point to spend
+Great soundtrack which fits in with the game well

+/-It's locked to 30FPS, personally I'm not bothered by this but I know this is an important issue for a lot of people
+/-While the game does feature a NG+ mode as well as two different endings the game has zero replay value to me, though that may just be because I really didn't enjoy playing it
+/-If you aren't very good at the game then it's incredibly difficult to unlock more than one or two of the skills as completing all three objectives in one go is pretty challenging

-Combat against a large group of enemies in open spaces is incredibly frustrating as it's often very difficult to find an opportunity to single out an enemy and kill them
-Enemy AI detection is awful, it's possible to stand on an enemy without them noticing, it's also possible to stand on a window while someone is looking out of it without them noticing
-Despite feeling like it should be a stealth game, Ronin seems to force open combat on you as much as possible, there's not a single level that be completed without engaging in open combat and very few encounters with enemies can be completed without combat
-The jump arc the game provides you with when you're planning your next move is pretty much always inaccurate which is incredibly frustrating
-The game enters turn-based mode when you enter combat, or at least that's how it's supposed to work. The game often doesn't enter turn-based mode at the right time and it never enters turn-based mode when it's convenient for the player, such as when you can attack an enemy from a rope. Furthermore, the game often leaves turn-based mode too soon, i.e. while there are still enemies left in play
-The backstory of the game is only explained in the Deluxe Edition Digital Comic so if you own the standard edition, like I do, the game effectively has no story
-The game consists of fifteen levels only and can be completed in around four hours, the only reason my playtime is longer than that is because I spent around two hours total stuck on some of the levels
-You can only jump when you're in combat, regular movement isn't allowed, this gets incredibly frustrating when you just need to move a small distance

Verdict:
Not Worth Purchasing Unless Heavily Discounted.

Ronin has a nice idea behind it but its weak gameplay, poor AI, short length and complete focus on action make it fall short of the mark. If you're looking for the next Gunpoint or Mark of the Ninja, look elsewhere.

No drama, Just Reviews.

El K.

JohnnyTheWolf - Qc

Recommended

Posted: June 30
*** REVIEW IN PROGRESS ***

Gunpoint with a greater emphasis on (turn-based) combat

PROS:
+ Decent replayability
+ Each fight is a puzzle
+ Challenging but fair difficulty
+ Simple yet addictive gameplay
+ Better readability than its inspiration
+ Visually reminiscent of Genndy Tartakovsky's work

CONS:
- Only fifteen levels
- No non-lethal takedown
- Trial-and-error gameplay
- Lacking story presentation
- Inability to run during combat
- Occasionally imprecise aim controls

Mitchfynde
378 products in account
57 reviews
Not Recommended
2.6 hrs on record
Posted: May 27
Early Access Review
I loved Gunpoint and I love Mark of the Ninja, so you can probably guess how bad I wanted this game. After playing it in Early Access, I'd have to say that I am pretty disappointed for a few reasons.
-the levels are painfully linear at times
-some of the fights are based completely on memorization
-I was under the impression that it was a stealth game

With that being said, I did have a lot of fun playing this game. The problem is that the fun was outweighed by my frustration in the bad game design. Hopefully the game will see some positive changes during Early Access. There's a lot of potential here to be realized.

Jebediah Kerbin
529 products in account
8 reviews
Recommended
8.0 hrs on record
Posted: June 29
Early Access Review
I remember seeing pretty much everything I ever wanted in a 2d game in GUNPOINT. It reminded me so much of old school gaming. Actually I was hoping it to be a PC version, much more complex of ELEVATOR ACTION.

I am still in love with Gunpoint and I have to say it is quite complex, maybe much more than I anticipated.

Then one day I saw a article in POLYGON about RONIN being just like Gunpoint in visual terms, but a Turn-based stealth ninja slashing game. I JUST LOVED THE COMBINATION ! ! ! ! AND GUNPOINT VISUALS ARE SO AMAZING!

I was seriously hooked by the idea and here I am, recomending this game.

- It is difficult !! I know that there are many good players who claimed all the objectives without any major problems, but to a average to low skill gamer like me , THERE IS SO MUCH CHALLENGE! :-)

- It is simple ! ! The game mechanics are very easy to learn, maybe difficult to master. You will be enjoying it in no time!

- The graphics ! ! ! Did I mention that they LOOK LIKE GUNPOINT ? I love it's visuals. First I thought it was the same person/studio that did Gunpoint, then I learned that Gunpoint's author did not mind, but was quite pleased for someone to use it's graphic style for such a different game like RONIN.

I am still trying to kill Wisegirl without getting myself locked down. It's is difficult, and I love it! :-)

Thanks for reading!

Posted: June 30
Early Access Review
I can say this game is wonderful. Nice music, cool action including throwing your katana at enemies and hitting them from windows and ledges and seeing them thud to the ground spraying red. Even the tutorial will grip you it's so fun and cool. What makes it even better is that you can take it slow and find the best way to take out the room of gun carrying enemies or go in fast and risk death, but get a really cool looking combo. Worth every cent/dollar.
